Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2012 05:07PM nancedawg wrote: Happee2BMe,  My surgery was 8/8 and I have been back to walking 5 miles a day for about a week now.  I tire more easily, but it doesn't completely knock me off my feet.  I go back to work the Thursday after Labor Day.  Lot of walking and reaching at work, so it will be interesting to see how I hold up.  I'm planning on wearing button down shirts that are not form fitting.  There is no way I could comfortably put anything against my skin right now(such as a bra). My underarms both feel like there is a big ball under there esp the right where the lymph nodes were.  My chest is still numb and my right shoulder blade.  I am assuming this is all normal.  Day by Day.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2012 01:59AM nancedawg wrote: BMX on Aug.8.  No pain meds yet, but feeling sore and uncomfortable.  My lower back hurts due to not being able to roll on my side.  The drains are a pain....hope to have them out soon.  So far not fun, but getting through it.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2012 03:09AM nancedawg wrote: Summer, I had that sore throat thing, but cold applesauce was great for a couple of days.  It is weird that my throat didn't hurt at all unless I was trying to eat.  Anyway, try yogurt or applesauce.  It didn't hurt me at all when they took the drains out, and I wasn't taking any pain meds, so you might not need that pill for that.  Hang in there.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2012 04:00AM nancedawg wrote: BMX on 8/8 12....Came home that night, no pain meds at all, drains out on 8/17/12, Dr's visit on 8/20/12 to drain 40cc's from left breast( not even the cancerous breast).  I am doing well so far.  I drove my daughter to college yesterday, 4 hour drive there, 4 hour drive back.  I put a pillow between me and the seatbelt which made it tolerable.  I will go back to work in 2 weeks.  We own a restaurant and I am the server.  I don't plan to wear fake breasts, so I guess I need clothing that somehow doesn't accent the manlike look.  This will be an adventure.  We close our restaurant in August every year and everyone always asks how the vacation went.  Not sure how to respond since I didn't tell them about the surgery.  My main goal is to make sure they don't feel uncomfortable. There is always something new to think about.  Oh yea, path report...17 nodes removed (right) 6 cancerous.  Tumor 2.1 cm.    My plan now is to fight any possible mets with diet and alternative treatment.  We'll see how that goes.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2012 08:39AM nancedawg wrote: Anyone out there who didn't get reconstruction?  Anyone out there opting out of post surgery treatment?
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2012 08:51AM nancedawg wrote: Sensitive skin....yep that's how one of you put it, and that is exactly what it is.  I am 3 weeks out and besides the golf balls under my arms (right specifically) that sensitive skin thing makes me crazy.  Also the tightness across my chest is so uncomfortable.  I was almost more comfortable with the bandages tightly across my chest because I didn't realize my chest would ACTUALLY be that tight all the time.  Also when you drink hot or cold beverages it feels like the liquid is outside of your body.  I wonder when that will subside.  I would like that lump of scar tissue under my arm cut right off...very uncomfortable...not painful, just uncomfortable.  Done ranting for today.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2012 12:00PM nancedawg wrote: It is interesting to me that so many people got antibiotics automatically with their surgery.  I wasn't even prescribed any antibiotics EVER, so I am curious about that.  Do they wait for infection or just automatically prescribe them?
